str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Very sorrowful, greatly grieved. From peri and lupe; grieved all around, i.e. Intensely sad.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An oath. From herkos; a limit, i.e. restraint.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To recline, especially at a dinner-table. From ana and keimai; to recline.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
From a compound of a and a derivative of tithemi; to set aside, i.e. to disesteem, neutralize or violate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
